findings.title: Integer Overflow and Underflow
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Outdated Compiler Version
findings.description: Using an outdated compiler version can lead to security vulnerabilities and compatibility issues.

findings.title: Floating Pragma
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Unchecked Call Return Value
findings.description: The smart contract does not check the return value of a call to another contract, which can lead to unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Unprotected Ether Withdrawal
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Unprotected SELF-DESTRUCT Instruction
findings.description: The contract contains an unprotected SELF-DESTRUCT instruction, which can lead to unintended destruction of the contract.

findings.title: Re-entrancy
findings.description: Velas Domain's smart contracts do not utilize re-entrancy guard to prevent re-entrant calls.

findings.title: State Variable Default Visibility
findings.description: The state variable has a default visibility which can lead to unauthorized access or unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Uninitialized Storage Pointer
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Assert Violation
findings.description: The assert statement can lead to unintended behavior or even contract failure if it evaluates to false.

findings.title: Use of Deprecated Solidity Functions
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated solidity functions which can lead to unexpected behavior and security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Delegate Call to Untrusted Callee
findings.description: Delegate call to an untrusted callee can lead to unauthorized access or manipulation of sensitive data.

findings.title: DoS with Failed Call
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Transaction Order Dependence
findings.description: The smart contract is vulnerable to transaction order dependence attacks.

findings.title: Authorization through tx.origin
findings.description: The modifier 'authorised' uses 'tx.origin' to check authorization, which can be vulnerable to phishing attacks.

findings.title: Block values as a proxy for time
findings.description: Using block values as a proxy for time can lead to vulnerabilities due to miners' control over block timestamps.

findings.title: Signature Malleability
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Incorrect Constructor Name
findings.description: The constructor name does not match the contract name.

findings.title: N/A
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Weak Sources of Randomness from Chain Attributes
findings.description: Using chain attributes as a source of randomness can be insecure because they can be manipulated by miners.

findings.title: Missing Protection against Signature Replay Attacks
findings.description: The smart contract lacks protection against signature replay attacks.

findings.title: Lack of Proper Signature Verification
findings.description: Missing protection against signature replay attacks and lack of proper signature verification.

findings.title: Requirement Violation
findings.description: The function does not meet the requirements.

findings.title: Write to Arbitrary Storage Location
findings.description: The setResolver function allows an attacker to write to arbitrary storage locations.

findings.title: Incorrect Inheritance Order
findings.description: The contract inherits from multiple interfaces or contracts but does not follow the correct order of inheritance.

findings.title: Insufficient Gas Griefing
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Arbitrary Jump with Function Type Variable
findings.description: The contract allows arbitrary jump with function type variable which can lead to unauthorized access and manipulation of the contract's state.

findings.title: DoS With Block Gas Limit
findings.description: Denial of Service (DoS) attack can occur when a contract uses block gas limit to restrict operations.

findings.title: Typographical Error
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Right-To-Left-Override control character (U+202E)
findings.description: The Right-To-Left-Override control character (U+202E) can be used to manipulate text and evade filters.

findings.title: Presence of unused variables
findings.description: Unused variables are present in the contract.

findings.title: Unexpected Ether balance
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Hash Collisions With Multiple Variable Length Arguments
findings.description: This finding indicates a potential vulnerability where hash collisions can occur due to multiple variable length arguments.

findings.title: Message call with the hardcoded gas amount
findings.description: The contract uses a hardcoded gas amount for message calls which can lead to unexpected behavior and potentially cause reentrancy attacks.

findings.title: Code With No Effects (Irrelevant/Dead Code)
findings.description: The code has no effects or is irrelevant/dead.
